page.title: 18GREEN END FARM.
page.content: Green End Farm had been derelict before the Second World War. Its owner was going to develop it into a housing estate.However the present owners bought the land in 1949 and restored it into agricultural land. The farm has many varied soils,these are thought to have been brought here by the melt waters from the last Ice-Age.The farm is arable and grass,with the crops and animals being rotated to maintain the quality of the soil.The farm consists of 60 acres,but a further 126 acres is rented.The farm is a family concern,worked by the owner and his son.The fields are all bordered by hedges,which will not be removed,a common practice on some farms.There are many historical features on the farm,such as the barn made from a galleon's timbers and the remains of a Roman settlement.
